newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: TENNIS-HINGIS MAKES WINNING RETURN TO KOSICE.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-HINGIS MAKES WINNING RETURN TO KOSICE.

text.p: Martina Hingis made a winning return to her birthplace on Saturday but her Swiss team were being held 1-1 by Slovakia in the Fed Cup.
Switzerland took the lead in the world group two first-round tie when Australian Open champion Hingis beat Katarina Studenikova 6-1 6-3.
Karina Habsudova drew Slovakia level 1-1 by beating Patty Schnyder 7-5 6-1.
Hingis, who was born in Kosice 16 years ago, got a kiss of congratulation from her father, Karol, who works as a groundkeeper and junior coach in Kosice.
"It was a nice feeling to play here after 12 years," said Hingis, who is unbeaten this year.
"I got a great welcome when I entered the court and it was also great to win.
"I think my father was keeping is fingers crossed for me even though I was actually playing against his country.".
Hingis sped through the first set in 28 minutes after breaking Studenikova in the first game and conceded only the fifth game.
In the second set, Hingis lost her serve, broke back, but again lost serve to trail 3-2.
In the sixth game, Studenikova had three points on serve for a 4-2 lead but Hingis kept her cool to level at 3-3 and went on to win the match.
"My serve is not my strongest point and I haven't played a match for the last two weeks," Hingis said.
"I knew I had to tighten up my game, managed it and got into it again," she added.
Habsudova, who recently made the world top 10 rankings, said she had had a slow start against left-hander Schnyder becasuse she had to get used to her style.
"I haven't played a left-hander in three years, so I had to adapt to her game and that was why the set was more eqal than the second," Habsudova said.
The Slovak number one meets Hingis in the first return singles on Sunday.
